page.title: 02MORRIS CASTLE, SWANSEA (1)
page.content: Morris Castle, or Castle Graig as it is also known, is situated on high ground at Trewyddfa and is unusual in that although only just over 210 years old, it is listed as an Ancient Monument. Extensive restoration work is scheduled for this year (1985). Castle Graig was built about 1768 by John Morris, an industrialist. Housing was needed for his work force of coal miners and copper workers, and this {'castle',}really a tenement{block,}was built, the first of its kind in the world. The 'castle' was built around a central courtyard with a tower of four floors at each corner. The towers were linked by three-storey blocks, the top block crowned with mock battlements. It is thought that up to 24 families were housed there. The building is now in disrepair.
